page.title: 09 ST. MARY'S CHURCH cont.
page.content: About 1310 the south aisle was enlarged to it's present width and the windows at the west end are Decorated in style. Towards the end of Edward III's reign the north aisle was enlarged in Perpendicular style as the windows show. About 1450 the south porch was built. Above it is a small room once used as a school room. Most of the stained glass was put in at the beginning of the 20th century but there are still some examples of medieval glass especially the so-called 'John of Gaunt' panel in the south aisle.
